snippet: After a disappointing Spanish bond auction, the European Central Bank cited concerns about a slowdown in the economy and a possible resurgence of the sovereign debt crisis.
abstract: Spain sells 2.6 billion euros ($3.4 billion) worth of bonds, near the bottom of its targeted range, unsettling financial markets; European Central Bank cites concerns about a slowdown in the economy and a possible resurgence of the sovereign debt crisis.

byline.original: By RAPHAEL MINDER and JACK EWING

lead_paragraph: After a disappointing Spanish bond auction, the European Central Bank cited concerns about a slowdown in the economy and a possible resurgence of the sovereign debt crisis.

headline.seo: Spain Jolts Euro Zone Back on Alert
headline.main: Spain Jolts Euro Zone Back on Alert
headline.print_headline: Spain’s Weak Bond Auction Troubles Markets as Europe Holds Rates
